Old Fashioned Pumpkin Pie

2 large eggs
1 large egg yolk
1/2 cup packed dark brown sugar
1/3 cup white sugar
1/2 teaspoon salt
2 teaspoons cinnamon
1 teaspoon ground ginger
1/4 teaspoon ground nutmeg
1/4 teaspoon ground cloves
1/8 teaspoon cardamom
1/2 teaspoon finely grated lemon zest
2 cups pumpkin pur√©e from a sugar pumpkin (see Recipe Note) OR 1 (15-ounce can) pumpkin pur√©e (can also use pur√©ed cooked butternut squash)
1 1/2 cups heavy cream or 1 (12-ounce) can evaporated milk
1 homemade pie crust, chilled or frozen (see p√¢te bris√©e recipe or our no-fail flaky pie crust recipe), or 2 pre-made pie shells

Preheat the oven:
Preheat your oven to 425¬∞F.
Make the filling:
Beat the eggs in a large bowl. Mix in the brown sugar, white sugar, salt, spices ‚Äî cinnamon, ground ginger, nutmeg, ground cloves, cardamom, and lemon zest.
Mix in the pumpkin pur√©e. Stir in the cream. Beat together until everything is well mixed.
mixing pumpkin pie ingredients
pumpkin pie ingredients mixed well
adding cream to pumpkin pie puree
pumpkin pie filling ready to add to pie
Fill the pie shell and bake:
Pour the filling into an uncooked chilled or frozen pie shell. Bake at a high temperature of 425¬∞F for 15 minutes.
Then after 15 minutes, lower the temperature to 350¬∞F. Bake for 45 to 55 minutes more. The pie is done when a knife tip inserted in the center comes out wet but relatively clean. The center should be just barely jiggly.
(About half-way through the baking, you may want to put foil around the edges or use a pie protector to keep the crust from getting too browned.)
Note that the pumpkin pie will come out of the oven all puffed up (from the leavening of the eggs), and will deflate as it cools.
pumpkin pie in dish ready for baking
Baked Pumpkin Pie From Scratch
Cool the pie on a rack, then serve:
Cool the pumpkin pie on a wire rack for 2 hours.
Serve with whipped cream.

If you're looking for a review on this game you've come to the wrong place, but if you're looking for an outstanding pie recipe you've come to the right place.

Ingredients:

1. 6 tablespoons unsalted butter
2. 1/2 cup white sugar
3. 1/2 cup brown sugar
4. 1/4 cup water
5. 1/4 teaspoon cinnamon
6. 1 pinch salt
7. 5 apples - peeled, cored and sliced
8. 1 pastry for double-crust pie

Directions:

1. Preheat oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C).
2. Combine butter, white sugar, brown sugar, water, cinnamon, and salt in a saucepan over medium heat. Bring to a boil, remove from heat and set aside.
3. Roll out half the pastry to fit a 9-inch pie plate. Place bottom crust in pie plate; pour in apple slices.
4. Roll out top crust into a 10-inch circle. Cut into 8 (1-inch) wide strips with a sharp paring knife or pastry wheel. Weave the pastry strips, one at a time, into a lattice pattern. Fold the ends of the lattice strips under the edge of the bottom crust and crimp to seal.
5. Pour butter-sugar mixture over top of pie, coating the lattice, and allowing any remaining sauce to drizzle through the crust.
6. Bake in the preheated oven for 15 minutes. Reduce heat to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C), and bake until the crust is golden brown, the caramel on the top crust is set, and the apple filling is bubbling, 35 to 40 more minutes. Allow to cool completely before slicing.

This game is extremely fun, if you haven't played or heard of it, it's a must have. the biggest downside in my opinion is that having Counter Strike: source is almost required. Other than that, it's a game to burn your freetime away, and it get more and more fun the more people you play with. because the community of this game is very dedicated, the workshop is constantly getting updated and there are infinitely many fun addons to get. you can find a playermodel of almost every iconic character from popular franchises, and there are also endless amounts of chaotic picture scenes you can make with ragdolls. This game can also appeal to you if you are big into Star wars or historic weapons, as there are so many choices of weapons, from Katanas, fish, sniper rifles, 2d doom guns, bow & arrows, laser-firing wii remotes, and so, so much more. this is just skimming the top of all the comedic fun you can have in this game, and to think it's only $10 makes it seem like Facepunch is losing it's money. I'd gladly buy this game full-price.

Enjoyable chaos fit for all. Tons of addons, dupes, and save games to check out. Some are obviously broken tho... but beside that factor, there is simply so much stuff to check out.
Also it used to be that when the game was younger, that the amount of addons you had greatly affected your performance, and it kinda still does if you pick out certain addons to use with the rest that you choose to use. But otherwise you could easily have 1000 addons and still run the game just fine. The only downside to such is how long it'd take to download all those addons, and also the collection creation system on steam for collections. (which, unrelated to the point of this review, i think need to be reworked for the editing/creating menus of collections for adding addons to said collections so that they are far less of a pain to deal with.)

I, alongside many others however will easily suggest this game to anyone who hasn't played GMod before, or even seen it, which if you haven't seen it before, I would recommend checking out people who have played gmod before to see what kinds of things they've done in it, when it comes to people who have put videos of such onto Youtube.

I am a 45 yo father, probably one of the oldest people playing this game. I am a single farther to my Son, who is 14 now. My son got this game for Christmas from his uncle, so we installed it on his computer and he started playing. By the end of the week he had 24 hours on this game. This was horrible for me, as it was already hard for me to find ways to spend time with my son, as he is always out with his friends or just, watching YouTube. So i decided to make a Steam account and get this game to see if I could maybe play alongside him. loaded into the game, made my character and world and started playing but I was stuck on what you where supposed to do. I asked my Son for help and he hosted a game for me to join. loved it as it was the best time had spent with my Son since my wife had died. This game has ever since brought me and my son closer again and now we actually spend time together outside the house together as well. This game reminded me that there's fun to be had in everything, and it has brought both me and my Son many happy memories.

It all started when I was 9 years olf. My dad came home from work with an old computer (he worked in computers) and he said "here, son. Have a video game." I took it and installed it that noight. What he DIDN't NOT tell me was that the previous owner (who was a really they/them) had DIED while playing Gatty's GMOD. 

Later that night, when I was playing a game of game's mod, I saw a scary blac kfigure appear and say "BOOFEDY BOOG" and disappear. I was so scared, I ran into my dad's room (mom is also dead) and screamed "DADDY DADDY! THE COMPITY IS HAMPITY!" He got so mad he hit me with a belt. He then told me to never wake him up again or next time it'll be TWO belts that spank me. I was more scared of him than the game in that moment.

So I went back iot my rooooooooooooooom to play more game. Then this time, a white figure (for diversity's sake) appeared in game and said "WHOOOOOOOO! THE ACCIDENT WAS DAD'S FAULT! YOU WERE ALSO AN ACCIDNET" and disappeared. I didnt' want to tell dad because two belts is scarier than one. And a belt in the hand is worth two in the bush. So I kept quiet and went back to gaming. 

I then opened up Coutner Strike and saw that there were no American servers. Not that there's a problem with that, I just don't like high ping. So that's when I opened GMOD and installed a pack of AIs that would act as bobts in place of real people so I could play Counter Strike maps.

The next thing I know, I woke up with a headache and found I wasn't awake, I was in the GAME! I was fighting against the white figure and the black figure and they were terrorists and I was CT (that's "counter terrorist" for anyone who DOESN'T PLAY) and I had to fight against them [no I'm not done yet] and I had to save Counter Strike Garry's Mod from terrorists.

I was then bullied in voice by the figures who turned to be my mom and my mom as well (BOOM! PLOT TWIST!)!!!)!!!!!! M Night Shamalamadingdongthatmanmakesnogoodmovies and then I saved them from being dead by letting them possess me. Now my dad is taking me to a therapist for screaming so loud at night. Thanks, Garry. IF THAT IS YOUR REAL NAME....>!!!!!!

The game has a really good premise, I'm aware. It's really funny to screw around with ragdolls and there's really no limit aside from your PC and what it can handle. Here's the problem: it's the most pure sandbox you can possibly think of. There are ZERO instructions (to my knowledge) on what the various tools do, and no real suggestions on what you could do. This leave people with an incredibly small imagination like kind of staring at all of this and just thinking "Well, now what?" The game's incredible if you know what you're doing, according to friends, but if you don't it's kind of overwhelming. This review is more of a warning of what you intend to get yourself into with this game, but there's fun to be had, I just haven't had it yet (as seen with my very low hours) and had no motivation to find it. Still, if you want to try animation, this is for some stupid reason a valid engine for 3D animation. Still, set a timer for about an hour and 50 minutes while you play and pause it when you take a break, just so you know when to refund it if it doesn't click.

-According to all known laws of aviation, there is no way a bee should be able to fly.

-Its wings are too small to get its fat little body off the ground.

-The bee, of course, flies anyway because bees don't care what humans think is impossible.

-Yellow, black. Yellow, black. Yellow, black. Yellow, black.

-Ooh, black and yellow!

-Let's shake it up a little.

-Barry! Breakfast is ready!

-Coming!

-Hang on a second.

-Hello?

-Barry?

-Adam?

-Can you believe this is happening?

-I can't.

-I'll pick you up.

-Looking sharp.

-Use the stairs, Your father paid good money for those.

-Sorry. I'm excited.

-Here's the graduate.

-We're very proud of you, son.

-A perfect report card, all B's.

-Very proud.

-Ma! I got a thing going here.

-You got lint on your fuzz.

-Ow! That's me!

-Wave to us! We'll be in row 118,000.

-Bye!

-Barry, I told you, stop flying in the house!

-Hey, Adam.

-Hey, Barry.

-Is that fuzz gel?

-A little. Special day, graduation.

-Never thought I'd make it.

-Three days grade school, three days high school.

-Those were awkward.

-Three days college. I'm glad I took a day and hitchhiked around The Hive.

-You did come back different.

-Hi, Barry. Artie, growing a mustache? Looks good.

-Hear about Frankie?

-Yeah.

-You going to the funeral?

-No, I'm not going.

-Everybody knows, sting someone, you die.

-Don't waste it on a squirrel.

-Such a hothead.

-I guess he could have just gotten out of the way.

-I love this incorporating an amusement park into our day.

-That's why we don't need vacations.

-Boy, quite a bit of pomp under the circumstances.

-Well, Adam, today we are men.

-We are!

-Bee-men.

-Amen!

-Hallelujah!

-Students, faculty, distinguished bees, please welcome Dean Buzzwell.

-Welcome, New Hive City graduating class of 9:15.

-That concludes our ceremonies And begins your career at Honex Industries!

-Will we pick our job today?, I heard it's just orientation.

-Heads up! Here we go.

-Keep your hands and antennas inside the tram at all times.

-Wonder what it'll be like?

-A little scary.

-Welcome to Honex, a division of Honesco and a part of the Hexagon Group.

This game saved my life.

I am 22.

My ex-wife and I have a daughter together, and adopted our son together. They are now both 4 years old.

When we were going through our separation, I found myself lost and miserable. I was self destructive. I got so mad one day from everything spiraling out of my control that I punched some concrete in a moment of overwhelming emotion. That caused me to break my 5th metacarpal in my right hand... my working hand... my games hand.. the hand that I held and carried my children to bed with.. The hand I desperately needed to make sure I could continue to provide.

After learning of the severity of my self-inflicted damage, I was borderline suicidal. Keep in mind that just a few months before this, I was the happiest man with no history of depression or anxiety. I have never had fits of rage, or been one to break down and cry, but I was in a low spot that just really buried me from being able to see the light on the other side.

Having nothing better to do, I searched for a game I could play, ONE HANDED while I recovered. I somehow stumbled upon this game and read some of the reviews. I decided that it had to be worth a shot... I must admit, I didn't beat the game, or play nearly as long as some of you. In fact, I may have only played this game a day or two.. With that being said, after doing so, I had a new found joy and hope for life. I was able to put behind me the pain and suffering that had been cast over me. I was able to experience other peoples joy and happiness. I was able to see the fruits of my "labor". I relaxed for 5 ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô• minutes to this music long enough to realize that I was going to be okay.

After coming to that realization, I turned the game off, and I went back to work. It hurt my hand like hell but I was motivated. I stopped feeling so damn sorry for myself, and I became the father I needed to be in that moment, not the weak boy I was behaving as.

Today, I am close friend with my kids mother. We don't fight, or argue, or say hurtful things to each other. We are parents, and friends.

I now have 3 kids. My third child is, wait for it, ALSO 4 YEARS OLD. The woman I am with was going through a very similar situation at the time of my own separation, and we just stumbled in to each others life unexpectedly. We have been in a relationship for a year now, and are very happy together.

Moral of the story, you never know what life holds in store for you, and if I would have given up when all the odds were stacked against me, I wouldn't be where I am today. This silly little game helped me realize that.

This is quite a fun game to play around in and do endless challenges and mods with friends.

The almost no end to things you can do makes it an easy choice to play again. Even though it can get annoying having to wait for server mods to load and you might not always have friends to play with.

The game does have a refreshing replayability role though and the tools we are giving are enough to keep our brains in our own creative world for hours on end.

It does deserve a nice 9/10. Not 10/10 because of the almost endless loading screens, the lonely feeling when not playing with friends, and the fact that when downloading mods sometimes it won'y work without some other mod that you had to get for it all to work.

Overall this game was great for a couple years but lately, it has shown many signs that it has died out.

Being a single parent to my daughter‚Äîwho is now 17‚Äîhas been difficult for the past two years; whether it's supporting my daughter's cello lessons, or catching up with her usage of the Xbox Game Pass, I've tried. Finding ways to connect with her through hobbies most natural for her age has been a tough journey, for she is always out with friends now, or watching Disney+ in her room.

I let her customize my Steam profile for me‚ÄîI asked for a goofy theme, and got something else instead, but as long as it makes her happy, so am I‚Äîand bought her Garry's Mod to see if I could perhaps play alongside her.

I recall all sorts of fun modes such as Prop Hunt back in my college days, groups of friends and online folks playing in-between study sessions. The highlights of those memories, those bits of enthusiasm, now I can share them with my Sarah. For the first time in the past five years, I was able to teach her a thing or two about a game! Come to think of it, this is the happiest I have ever seen her while being 'Player 2' for a change.

After spending countless hours playing this in the past, now I can make it easier for Sarah while she takes her Steam Deck whenever we go out camping at our local lake. If her mother hadn't passed away due to C-19, I know she would be here with us, proud to see our beloved daughter spend some time as an extroverted adolescent. Now Sarah's all into crazy mods and physics videos! Thank you for bringing new, geeky moments for me to share with my little girl!

WHAT CAN I SAY About Garry's Mod. Gareth's Modification. Like War and Peace there is seemingly no end to the seamless blending of suffering and joy. You will laugh, you will cry, you will come to know this game as a family member, like a son you can't entirely relate to despite trying your best, or perhaps an uncle who gets a little too political at the thanksgiving table. This game has excellent finger-feel. I press the W key and watch as my virtual avatar glides across the soft, summer grass as though it were effortless, hearing the crunch of a field, the click-clack of my virtual feet moving across virtual pavement. This is Garry's Mod (Gareth's Modification). When I go to GM_Construct (The GM stands for Garry's Mod) I can build anything my imagination so desires, all while being watched by a strange man of black, my guardian angel perhaps. If building does not suit my fancy I can change modes with the press of a button! I can become a masked man playing a game not unlike the popular award-winning video game Among Us. I can become a common object (Referred to as "props" in this game) and hide as alien hunters seek me! Much like the popular award-winning video game Among Us. Or Perhaps, if I would prefer to challenge my creativity, I can enter a mode in which I must build a ship to survive a flood and then battle against others in Pirate-esk warfare. NOT like the popular award-winning video game Among Us.

What more could I possibly say in regards to this incredible work of art? A gift to the generations. Were my words to be etched into history in regards to my thoughts on this game what would I say?

One of the greatest games ever made. Let's you push the limits of your imagination (and the source engine).

It's hard to describe what garry's mod is. On one hand, it's a sandbox with the choice of adding 1000's of mods to play with. Want to pit some dark souls boss against a resident evil one? Go ahead! Set up a massive firefight between stormtroopers xenomorphs? Sure!! Even if you don't want to touch the mods (it's in the title so, why not?) you can still have loads of fun with the tools the game comes with. Pose models, position lights, the skybox is the limit with this game. 

On the other hand, there are countless custom multiplayer modes which were the foundation for some of the greatest multiplayer games today. Trouble in Terrorist Town, prop hunt, deathrun (which is sadly dead from what I could find). The games are janky at times and filled with custom mods, but it only adds to the charm of the game. Role Playing servers can also get intensely fun and immersive with the right community. 

Don't be intimidated with the lack of direction the game gives you. Just go play and see what happens.

[b]Game Play[/b] - [i]9/10[/i]
The dynamic nature of Garry's Mod is what makes this game so enjoyable. You can have anything from large-scale NPC battles to weird role play. The list is not limitless, since this game is very much limited by its engine, however it offers a large enough list of things to do that it makes the game play entirely up to the person and their imagination. The game modes made available to the player are numerous and many are enjoyable with random people or your friends.

[b]Maps and Textures[/b] - [i]8/10[/i]
Despite being released for Half Life 2, in 2004, the graphical integrity and quality for many custom-made maps is extremely outstanding, even by today's standards. The thematic qualities of different user-made maps varies, as one can guess, but the overall quality is very much there. The largest challenge that most maps suffer from is grass texture issues, in which the grass does not load properly on many maps, anymore. This is usually caused by different kinds of mods, but it remains to be a long-time issue prevalent in classic and modern maps. The other largest challenge with the variety of maps is finding specific maps with AI Nodes and Navigation meshes. What these meshes do is that they allow NPCs and different kinds of Nextbots move around on the map. Sadly, many maps lack the nodegraph or navigational meshes needed and so this may limit your choices of maps, extensively, depending on what you're looking for. Another additional problem, one that is extremely common-place, is the need for additional games to be downloaded and mounted onto Garry's Mod. This is a common issue, since many custom maps are designed with custom textures added, these textures can range from set pieces and props, to level textures and many of them are used from other games, such as Counter Strike: Source or Day of Defeat: Source. As a result, not only are you downloading Garry's Mod, but you are also downloading three or four additional games and mounting them in Garry's Mod, to allow various levels and custom maps to use certain texture settings. It's a pain and frankly can make this game harder to justify, when it sacrifices tons of space on your drive. However, these are just precautionary warnings.

[b]NPCs[/b] - [i]7/10[/i]
NPCs are a major part of game play and make up a significant chunk of my personal play time on this game. The world of NPCs is vast and features a lot of options, ranging from simple reskinned combine soldiers to fully mounted, configured, and developed custom NPCs with their own base systems and everything. In this review we will be looking at the two most common types on the Workshop - reskinned NPCs and VJ Base NPCs. The reskinned NPCs are self-explanatory, but are essentially the most easily found mods on the Workshop. They are usually some of the simplest and are therefor the easiest to use in your games. With some extra mods and tools, you can easily craft a large and highly dynamic experience with modded NPCs using custom weapons. They are heavily limited by the aforementioned nodegraphing that is necessary in custom maps, but with this exception being made, they are some of the most fun and simplest to use. The other most popular NPC type is VJ Base NPCs, which use a separately customized system and are far more intelligent compared to the base-game NPCs that are simple reskins. These NPCs are not reliant on the nodegraphs and are therefore superior when it comes to using them on more maps. However, they are more demanding on your server and can easily crash your game, if there is too much happening, at once. There is also many mods that use VJ Base, that haven't been properly updated or taken care of, being abandoned by their mod authors, which causes significant issues on your game.

[b]Weapons[/b] - [i]8/10[/i]
As previously mentioned, the dynamic nature of Garry's Mod enables you to easily mod and change your game play to fit your needs. This is especially the case when it comes to weapons. The vast amount of guns, explosives, melee weapons, and nuclear weapons that can be downloaded is extremely extensive. Many weapons can range in quality, some being simple and using the default Half Life style and system of gun play to the more modern and advanced gun-modifying systems of CW 2.0 and TFA. The choice is entirely up to you and your preferences, as well as your willingness to try out new and strange things. The use of guns is more prevalent compared to the modding of melee weapons, on the workshop, meaning that most mods will change how guns work and feel, while melee weapons are available, but don't offer a lot in the way of changing game play from the original days of Half Life 2 and using a crowbar. All around, with the advancement of different custom-made systems, like the Grewitch Emplacements and Tanks, as well as the aforementioned gun modifying mods, has seriously unlocked the possibilities made available to you that were previously unavailable.

[b]Engine[/b] - [i]6/10[/i]
This game is extremely fun and offers a lot, but the modding community is unfortunately stuck with the current engine of Source. This means that there are massive limits set on the abilities that different mod authors can and can't do. The world of Gmod is sadly condemned to the restrictions set in place, when the developers were designing Half Life 2. This means that massive battles of over several hundred men are not possible, maps larger than 1/2 km (0.3 miles) are not possible, and having too many props can easily dismantle frame rate. The largest of these challenges being that mod authors have basically outpaced the system and severe limitations set by the Source engine. While Source is not a terrible engine, it is sadly an engine that suffers from its age and the numerous limits set for it. The modding community has very easily outpaced it.

I am a 45 yo father, probably one of the oldest people playing this game. I am a single farther to my Son, who is 14 now. My son got this game for Christmas in 2021 from his uncle, so we installed it on his computer and he started playing. By the end of the week he had 24 hours on this game. This was horrible for me, as it was already hard for me to find ways to spend time with my son, as he is always out with his friends or just watching YouTube. So I decided to make a Steam account and get this game to see if I could maybe play alongside him. I loaded into the game, picked my character and started playing but I was stuck on what you where supposed to do. I asked my Son for help and he hosted a game for me to join. I loved it as it was the best time I had spent with my Son since my wife had died. This game has ever since brought me and my son closer again and now we actually spend time together outside the house together as well. This game reminded me that there's fun to be had in everything, and it has brought both me and my Son many happy memories.

My name is Walter Hartwell White. I live at 308 Negra Arroyo Lane, Albuquerque, New Mexico, 87104. This is my confession. If you're watching this tape, I'm probably dead, murdered by my brother-in-law Hank Schrader. Hank has been building a Virtual Youtuber empire for over a year now and using me as his recruiter. Shortly after my 50th birthday, Hank came to me with a rather, shocking proposition. He asked that I use my Live2D knowledge to recruit talents, which he would then hire using his connections in the Japanese utaite world. Connections that he made through his career with Niconico. I was... astounded, I... I always thought that Hank was a very moral man and I was... thrown, confused, but I was also particularly vulnerable at the time, something he knew and took advantage of. I was reeling from a cancer diagnosis that was poised to bankrupt my family. Hank took me on a ride along, and showed me just how much money even a small indie channel could make. And I was weak. I didn't want my family to go into financial ruin so I agreed. Every day, I think back at that moment with regret. I quickly realized that I was in way over my head, and Hank had a partner, a man named Motoaki "Yagoo" Tanigo, a businessman. Hank essentially sold me into servitude to this man, and when I tried to quit, Yagoo threatened my family. I didn't know where to turn. Eventually, Hank and Yagoo had a falling out. From what I can gather, Hank was always pushing for a greater share of the business, to which Yagoo flatly refused to give him, and things escalated. Yagoo was able to arrange, uh I guess I guess you call it a "hit" on my brother-in-law, and failed, but Hank was seriously injured, and I wound up paying his medical bills which amounted to a little over $177,000. Upon recovery, Hank was bent on revenge, working with a man named Riku Tazumi , he plotted to kill Yagoo, and did so. In fact, the bomb that he used was built by me, and he gave me no option in it. I have often contemplated suicide, but I'm a coward. I wanted to go to the police, but I was frightened. Hank had risen in the ranks to become the head of the Cover Corp, and about that time, to keep me in line, he took my children from me. For 3 months he kept them. My wife, who up until that point, had no idea of my vtubing activities, was horrified to learn what I had done, why Hank had taken our children. We were scared. I was in Hell, I hated myself for what I had brought upon my family. Recently, I tried once again to quit, to end this nightmare, and in response, he gave me this. I can't take this anymore. I live in fear every day that Hank will kill me, or worse, hurt my family. I... All I could think to do was to make this video in hope that the world will finally see this man, for what he really is.

Essentially, Garry's mod, is a sandbox game created from Valve's source engine and released in 2006.

It basically has no set objectives, you as the player, can freely do what you please with objects and the world around you. This is a mod for the creative, for the fun, its experimentation, learning and great social interaction. Its basically just silly goose time!

From manipulation to building, there are integrated mods,maps, props, characters and contraptions to use. Its a free for all, for the creative and great to play with friends.

Its an absolute classic with overwhelming reviews.

If  you are this way inclined go for your life, what other ways to do this shit than in real life!

If you're looking for a review on this game you've come to the wrong place, but if you're looking for an outstanding pie recipe you've come to the right place.

Ingredients:

1. 6 tablespoons unsalted butter
2. 1/2 cup white sugar
3. 1/2 cup brown sugar
4. 1/4 cup water
5. 1/4 teaspoon cinnamon
6. 1 pinch salt
7. 5 apples - peeled, cored and sliced
8. 1 pastry for double-crust pie

Directions:

1. Preheat oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C).
2. Combine butter, white sugar, brown sugar, water, cinnamon, and salt in a saucepan over medium heat. Bring to a boil, remove from heat and set aside.
3. Roll out half the pastry to fit a 9-inch pie plate. Place bottom crust in pie plate; pour in apple slices.
4. Roll out top crust into a 10-inch circle. Cut into 8 (1-inch) wide strips with a sharp paring knife or pastry wheel. Weave the pastry strips, one at a time, into a lattice pattern. Fold the ends of the lattice strips under the edge of the bottom crust and crimp to seal.
5. Pour butter-sugar mixture over top of pie, coating the lattice, and allowing any remaining sauce to drizzle through the crust.
6. Bake in the preheated oven for 15 minutes. Reduce heat to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C), and bake until the crust is golden brown, the caramel on the top crust is set, and the apple filling is bubbling, 35 to 40 more minutes. Allow to cool completely before slicing.

Addicting and very fun. Got this game because a friend wanted to try Prop Hunt and found that I really enjoy it, especially jumping on public servers. It is definitely a big creative outlet with many maps, assets, mods, and more that make each play (of whatever gamemode you're playing) unique. You have the possibility to connect with people locally and around the world, play through countless maps and discover new tricks and downloads. It's a great game to get to feed your inner creative and test your mind (in Prop Hunt). You may need some games to have assets load in on common maps, which might cost more but is a great investment in the long run.
$10 and a few gigs of space will get you every other game on the platform with this one folks.

[h1]A must-have for every player [/h1]
Garry's mod is a masterpiece when it comes to being a sandbox game. It's easy to play with friends or singleplayer and you have tons of diffirent choices you can make with this game. The workshop is pretty much the main concept of it then, which allows you to try out custom made gamemodes, maps, showcases, weapons, entities and much more, even change the whole look of the original game. The devs also keep the game regulary updated and listen to our responses. 

From the price (especially when being on sale) and overall content you can get with this game. It's a must-have for every steam user and everyone should at least try it out once.

now now, lets be honest, If you found this game, you know what you were looking for, a sandbox game you can burn more free time than you thought you ever had into a game with few limitations.  the best way to sum up only half of what you can do is as follows; "You can be Master Chief riding a T 90 MS using a lightsaber through a crowd of Minecraft zombies who have plasma cannons, while an ARC 170 dogfights a spitfire in space, on the moon."  if that doesn't suit you, then try building an incredibly complex machine with WIREMOD, or just download some particles and ragdolls and master the posing tools.  that doesn't work? try highly organized team battles, free for alls while riding horses, get trapped in a Pok√©ball and thrown off a cliff, or terrorize your friends with nexbots.

I am a 45 yo father, probably one of the oldest people playing this game. I am a single farther to my Son, who is 14 now. My son got this game for Christmas, so we installed it on his computer and he started playing. By the end of the week he had 24 hours on this game. This was horrible for me, as it was already hard for me to find ways to spend time with my son, as he is always out with his friends or just, watching YouTube. So i decided to make a Steam account and get this game to see if I could maybe play alongside him. loaded into the game, made my character and world and started playing but I was stuck on what you where supposed to do. I asked my Son for help and he hosted a game for me to join. loved it as it was the best time had spent with my Son since my wife had died. This game has ever since brought me and my son closer again and now we actually spend time together outside the house together as well. This game reminded me that there's fun to be had in everything, and it has brought both me and my Son many happy memories.

I can't fucking believe this. Pink from 'Among Us' ruined my marriage.

A couple months ago, my wife said she was going out for a ladies' night. She asked me to take care of my son, so I immediately obliged. "Yes Ma'am," I told her. After a while of waiting, she finally left and I could play my favourite game, Among Us. I hopped on my laptop, booted it up and my desktop loaded, complete with the 'Red Sus' background and all my Among Us Impostor fan-art. I was shaking in excitement. I slowly dragged my finger across the track pad, and watched the cursor as it glided over to the Among Us icon. Among Us. My absolute favourite game of all time and quite possibly the best and most well-made game in the entire world. As I clicked the button my body twitched with joy at the thought of being the impostor again. My fingers drummed impatiently on my desk as the Innersloth logo faded in, and then out. Then the main title appeared. I immediately looked at pink as she slowly floated across the screen. Oh, how I wish I could feel those luscious, soft asscheeks. Pink is my queen. The real woman in my life. My wife could never be as sexy as Pink is; her soft footfalls in electrical as I peek at her curvy form from inside a vent, waiting for the right time to strike. I could never get close to Pink, however, as if she had some kind of sixth sense, she would always leave before I could reveal myself to her as the impostor. I press Practice, to warm up my fingers before my first intense game of Among Us. I hit Blue in Comms, then cross the hall and vent to Specimen, murdering Green in cold blood. The thrill of killing an animated character in an online game has never been such a rush. I then move towards Reactor, stabbing Yellow in the back and then running down the corridor to the right to access Decontamination. I move quietly through the halls, like a snake about to strike its prey, and I see- Oh no. It's Pink. Standing there motionlessly as I face her directly. Her visor shows no emotion. But she knows. I can feel it in the air. I can't kill her. She is too beautiful, too angelic, the light reflecting off of her pink bodysuit, like stars on a voided sky. She doesn't run. I am moved to tears as I caress the screen, kissing it tenderly. "Goodbye, Pink. See you soon. It will all be okay," I whisper in a soft, reassuring voice. Then as my cursor hovers over the kill button, I hesitate. Thoughts of love go through my head. Red having reddish-pink sus children with Pink. But I have to. As the impostor, it is my duty to kill. I press the 'Kill' button and watch as my character beheads Pink silently. All I hear is the spurt of blood. There is no rush. There is only Red, standing by himself in Fuel. Pink's lifeless body laying on the floor beside him. I feel nothing at first, then immense sadness, like I'm at a loved one's funeral. My son knocks on the door, interrupting my brief moment of mourning. He asks, "Dad? Are you going to make me a snack?" I tell him to shut up, and my voice cracks. I break down sobbing. I killed her. I killed my one true love. God, forgive me. I open the door to my son, and he has a confused look on his face. I say nothing, and walk to the kitchen to make him a sandwich. Tears roll off my face into the bread as I lay it onto the counter. Lettuce, cheese and meat, followed by a sad swirl of mustard on top. My son is quiet. He sits on the couch, and stares at the floor. There is a depressing air around us. I serve him the sandwich and walk back to my room, contemplating life. If I killed Pink, how am I to be trusted around my family? I cry for hours, and finally my wife comes back. She sees me bawling on the bed like a child who dropped his ice cream. She then asks me why I'm crying and mutter, "I killed her. I killed my only love, Pink, in Among Us." She is filled with rage and slaps me across my face. I feel numb. She asks for a divorce. I don't reply. Instead, I take my laptop and get into my car, driving to a nearby hotel. Fast forward a few months to the divorce. It was quick and painless. After court, I ask my former wife to take me back.


"I can't take you back. You've always been this way. I was sus of you from the start."

This game defined the joy and nostalgia of an entire generation of internet gremlins; nowadays, it's full of has-beens playing washed-up, uninteresting stories. Built upon an engine that is nearly 2 decades old and essentially requiring the additional purchase of Counter-Strike Source, Garry's Mod is a game defined best by its infinite replayability. Want to be Freddy Fazbear piloting the TARDIS through Star Wars planets? You can do that. You want to get a bunch of friends together and play a private game of Prop Hunt and build life time memories? You can do that. This game has anything you could ask for; however, after a decade of playing Garry's Mod, the memories stick and overwrite the new to be had, and prevent any fun to be had and instead being replaced by the eternal longing for the past. 

Is this a good game? It's one of the best. Built upon one of the most key, industry-defining titles and engines, and supported with thousands, if not millions, of mods from its very dedicated fan-base, Garry's Mod is a game worth checking out if you are new to PC, looking to revisit better times, or just looking for something to kill some time. 

Tl;dr: buy it and CSS.

I must remark,

I'm very gracious to have been gifted this game by a friend.
When I first began playing "Garry's Mod", I finally realized that this was the part of my life that had been missing. Like the lost puzzle piece had been found.

This computer game is quite enjoyable when playing with friends, a myriad of hours playing Sandbox, hysterically laughing as we compete in You Touched it Last, Prop Hunt, or Gun Game, mocking bad horror maps, or have an appalling time on a good map that manages to spook us.

I have had many fun times from this game, I could never recommend a game more. If you have enough currency to cough up, this is a purchase you won't regret.

Thank you, Mr. Garry, for your mod.

I've always been lookin' for games where I can do whatever the heck I want. Garry's Mod is EXACTLY that! What's particularly immersive is playing with NPCs, making them fight and whatnot. Sure, you might need addons, but they're free, and don't even take up that much extra space for the game! This is definitely my favorite physics and artificial intelligence sandbox. If you like screwing around with either of those and you like feeling like a god/goddess, this is an AWESOME game. With the local multiplayer, and lots of realistic features, it's also good for setting up immersive little games with your friends. I would definitely recommend this if you want to have a good time with your friends and even by yourself.

I bought this game at around 2020 just to make my self entertained while quarantine was occurring. It turns out, this was not just a grab-n-go type of game, no no no. This game is a masterpiece of the source engine and a gem in the store. Garry's Mod also has an amazing community that is active 24/7 creating dupes, mods, models and so much more!
The multiplayer in this game is okay, but not at its peak. 2012 was the best time to play Garry's Mod for the multiplayer, also in 2012, Prop Hunt was one of the reasons the game was so popular. 
If your gonna play a multiplayer gamemode(s), make sure to play DarkRP, its one of the more active gamemodes upon the others.
If you are going to buy the game, I really would recommend getting this game if you have $10 lying around. Its an amazing game once you add at least 10 mods and play on a server.

I have a very very fond opinion on this game, while the game may not be perfect my memories are. I met almost all my friends on steam from playing Garry's Mod. I had relationships met my first serious girlfriend from this game. I have screenshots saved to a usb of old friends who passed away that I used to play with. I miss waking up everyday logging into steam playing GMod with my friends for hours and hours. The game has a very special place in my heart. I remember watching Seananners and Gassymexican play PHunt and TTT which was just a thrill to 13 year old me. I was an admin for multiple servers throughout my time in this game. From TTT Prop Hunt Star Wars RP, and even death run. I played so many games made so many memories and sometimes I miss the "good ol times" because the good times for me where with Garry's Mod. I know they are working on a new version of the game and I hope it sparks the love I have again and that maybe I can even meat new people and make new friends. I have been friends with the people I met on here going on 6 years now. I l0ove this game so much with all my heart. Thank you for creating such amazing memories. This was also the game to get me started in the PC world. I remember playing phunt with my friends on my shitty old laptop. Now I am here typing this on a 2 thousand dollar setup and I just hope anyone who still plays this game for the first time can make the same memories I did with this game <3

f you're looking for a review on this game you've come to the wrong place, go below, but if you're looking for an outstanding pie recipe you've come to the right place.

Ingredients:

1. 6 tablespoons unsalted butter
2. 1/2 cup white sugar
3. 1/2 cup brown sugar
4. 1/4 cup water
5. 1/4 teaspoon cinnamon
6. 1 pinch salt
7. 5 apples - peeled, cored and sliced
8. 1 pastry for double-crust pie

Directions:

1. Preheat oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C).
2. Combine butter, white sugar, brown sugar, water, cinnamon, and salt in a saucepan over medium heat. Bring to a boil, remove from heat and set aside.
3. Roll out half the pastry to fit a 9-inch pie plate. Place bottom crust in pie plate; pour in apple slices.
4. Roll out top crust into a 10-inch circle. Cut into 8 (1-inch) wide strips with a sharp paring knife or pastry wheel. Weave the pastry strips, one at a time, into a lattice pattern. Fold the ends of the lattice strips under the edge of the bottom crust and crimp to seal.
5. Pour butter-sugar mixture over top of pie, coating the lattice, and allowing any remaining sauce to drizzle through the crust.
6. Bake in the preheated oven for 15 minutes. Reduce heat to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C), and bake until the crust is golden brown, the caramel on the top crust is set, and the apple filling is bubbling, 35 to 40 more minutes. Allow to cool completely before slicing.

If you're looking for a review on this game you've come to the wrong place, but if you're looking for an outstanding pie recipe you've come to the right place.

Ingredients:

1. 6 tablespoons unsalted butter
2. 1/2 cup white sugar
3. 1/2 cup brown sugar
4. 1/4 cup water
5. 1/4 teaspoon cinnamon
6. 1 pinch salt
7. 5 apples - peeled, cored and sliced
8. 1 pastry for double-crust pie

Directions:

1. Preheat oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C).
2. Combine butter, white sugar, brown sugar, water, cinnamon, and salt in a saucepan over medium heat. Bring to a boil, remove from heat and set aside.
3. Roll out half the pastry to fit a 9-inch pie plate. Place bottom crust in pie plate; pour in apple slices.
4. Roll out top crust into a 10-inch circle. Cut into 8 (1-inch) wide strips with a sharp paring knife or pastry wheel. Weave the pastry strips, one at a time, into a lattice pattern. Fold the ends of the lattice strips under the edge of the bottom crust and crimp to seal.
5. Pour butter-sugar mixture over top of pie, coating the lattice, and allowing any remaining sauce to drizzle through the crust.
6. Bake in the preheated oven for 15 minutes. Reduce heat to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C), and bake until the crust is golden brown, the caramel on the top crust is set, and the apple filling is bubbling, 35 to 40 more minutes. Allow to cool completely before slicing.

Gmod... What a game. Garry's mod... what a game. A game where Garry mods stuff... what a game. Countless memories, Countless mods, Countless friends that i have made on here. I can remember the smell of burning food because my dad would beat the shit out of my mom while she was cooking and the food would just sit there and burn, I would play gmod to get away from it all. Gmod has done nothing but help me escape from reality, It was my peace of mind, my security. I would play it night and day and sometimes I even thought I was Garry. But then like a car crash, I would snap back to reality and realize that I was still stuck in the same crack house with my stupid mom and dad. Garry saved me. The mods helped me. and the game freed me. i recommend this game to anyone who thinks about running away from it all and starting a new life. You can be whoever you want inside of garry's mod. You know, I heard a saying once. I think it went like "In a world where you can be whoever you want, Be yourself. Anyway, This game is great and if you are debating buying it. Don't. it will make you fall down a dark spiral of depression. It will make your normal life never amount to what it could've been in gmod. You will wake up and only want gmod. You will hate your life because gmod is where you can really live. You will start using heroin, so you can black out and be in gmod. You will lose your wife, your kids, yourself. You will lose everything you've ever loved. So even though it is a great game. DO NOT BUY IT. Please enjoy your life and do not lose it to gmod. I miss my kids.

[h1]Before I start[/h1]

Nobody can resist Garry's Mod for it's creativity. Sure it might be very old and unoptimized but from all the hours that I have played, it has changed. from increasing the max addon size limit to adding it's own features even in 2022.


[h1]Pro's[/h1]

[b]1.[/b] From years and years of experience, it has a lot of in-game tools. (including the large amount of addons)

[b]2.[/b] It's unlikely for you to find any malware in the well-rated addons. (I have only heard of malware in some addons but yet again, it's so hard to find actual malware unless you look at the badly rated ones)

[b]3.[/b] Garry's mod inspired many people to make content. You can easily make content from animation to cinematics using this game. (Even I managed to make some content out of this)

[b]4.[/b] Endless fun. You can go from feeling like a noob to laughing your __s off in a mere year of playing Garry's Mod.

[b]5.[/b] Multiplayer. It has plenty of community created game-modes and servers. And you can host one yourself too with not only p2p, but also a dedicated server and/or LAN servers.




[h1]Cons[/h1]

[b]1.[/b] It's hard for new people to understand this game. (but usually the hints help with that)

[b]2.[/b] A lot of the multiplayer gamemodes and servers can be unbalanced or empty. most people like one certain gamemode which causes this imbalance.

[b]3.[/b] Connecting to any multiplayer server usually takes long especially with all the addons on the server. I got used to it at least.

[b]4.[/b] Addon conflicts may or may not happen. Luckily, the Garry's Mod developers made a solution to this issue by showing what addon is causing what issue. And the error message(s) is/are the real focus of solving such issue. Sometimes it's difficult to find what addon conflicts with another.




[h1]Rating[/h1]
I'd give it a 9.25/10. nothing is perfect.

With about an estimated 5k hours stretched across several accounts, this game was fun, WAS. Everything post late 2019-2020 in this game fucking SUCKS. I dunno what happened but it just seems like I've experienced everything, and this game is meant to be replayable with numerous amounts of game modes. I'm gonna split this review into multiple topics that I believe hold my argument up.

Let's start off with TTT. It has been taken over by inventory systems, which I don't mind, I've put more hours into those servers more than I would like to admit and probably got a gambling addiction from them. But they're ALL. THE. SAME. Same code, same shit. Almost everything uses the old moat code because everyone saw how that titan did after it fell. They're show very little variety over each other and now I feel like playing them is a chore. After deconning everything on Tera about 5-6 months ago I came back just out of boredom and was met with the new player experience. Not fun. Didn't stay long. New players just won't understand or will get discouraged because some sweatlord with a chell model killed them with their cosmic/planetary gun. That's just how it goes, it's always been like that. BUT Tera does do a good job at welcoming them and giving them a meh ascended to start out with because they were aware that this would be an issue. I don't know if they still do that anymore, but that was the most notable thing that I noticed back when I joined the server in October. I think, I dunno I'm bad with dates. GarnetGaming is so popular because it's just barebones TTT but with CS knives because they have to do that for everything. Velk and Tera should adopt ways to teach players about the economy and gun system. Because the first thing new players see is a black screen that only tells them they have an inventory, guide them through the system with like a tutorial or something. But with the options of Velk and Tera, they're most likely going to join both of them and see nothing unique between the two. They're just the same server. Now you could argue with gun difference but that becomes obsolete because both of the servers do absolutely NOTHING to change the core gameplay. It's just become Call of Duty at this point. I swear every year I see a new inventory server that uses the moat code and join to be met with disappointment. 
I am DESPERATELY trying to find a server that does something different. Speaking of servers that did something differently, Pluto. Someone revive Pluto. Please. I would but I am not very code savvy and have no idea how to run or even start a server. Pluto was the most fun I've had on this game because it was something fresh and not just another moat clone with a new coat of paint. 

Gmod is just not what is used to be. I'm sure you've heard it a fuck ton of times relating to old games but it is AGGRESSIVELY present with gmod. With the community refusing to adapt and change this game's entertainment value slowly became to fade away. Nothing new is ever made anymore and it's all just the same shit. Now, if you're JUST NOW buying this 16 year old source mod and going into it with the intention to play sandbox alone or with your buddies, GREAT. This game was intended to be a sandbox game. You will 100% have fun with the multiplayer but once you play it enough you will become jaded. Because no one wants to change or adapt and only want to do the things they know will rack in player counts.
This is destined to happen to more players that have this exact issue since nothing is changing. Whenever I was playing Tera I always felt disappointed that the players I used to play with constantly had stopped playing. 

Now. If you look closely in the gamemodes list. You may see two little letters that stand out. 'RP'. This isn't just a TTT issue, this has affected I think the second biggest game mode. But at least these servers change up the setting and add related weapons, playermodels, etc. So I can't nag on them much.

I am a 45 yo father, probably one of the oldest people playing this game. I am a single farther to my Son, who is 14 now. My son got this game for Christmas, so we installed it on his computer and he started playing. By the end of the week he had 24 hours on this game. This was horrible for me, as it was already hard for me to find ways to spend time with my son, as he is always out with his friends or just, watching YouTube. So i decided to make a Steam account and get this game to see if I could maybe play alongside him. loaded into the game, made my character and world and started playing but I was stuck on what you where supposed to do. I asked my Son for help and he hosted a game for me to join. loved it as it was the best time had spent with my Son since my wife had died. This game has ever since brought me and my son closer again and now we actually spend time together outside the house together as well. This game reminded me that there's fun to be had in everything, and it has brought both me and my Son many happy memories

One of the first things that struck me when I started playing Half-Life: Alyx was the dirt under Alyx Vance‚Äôs fingernails. It‚Äôs a simple thing, but it‚Äôs not often that you see that level of fine detail in a VR game. Usually, virtual hands are either low-detail ghostly apparitions or gloved. This grit also tells us something about this character, a scrappy survivor raised in the aftermath of the Seven-Hour War in which the alien Combine conquered Earth, and it quickly establishes that she isn‚Äôt as buttoned-down as that MIT-educated nerd Dr. Gordon Freeman. Subtle as it is, it sets the stage for the best VR shooter I‚Äôve ever played by a mile ‚Äì and one of the best in any perspective.

The next thing that stood out, jarring me out of gazing at my hands like a first-time stoner, was probably the gigantic, 30-foot Strider leg that smashed down directly in front of me as it moved past, going about its business. That established, with great force, the immense scale of the mosquito-like alien tanks we first fought in Half-Life 2 ‚Äì if you didn‚Äôt take them seriously as a threat before, it‚Äôs now impossible not to. The same otherworldly sound design that made the landscape of the gulag-like City 17 so memorable back in 2004 is in full effect here as well, and full-3D surround sound intensifies all of these recognizable pieces.
Aside from the new perspective, Alyx feels very much like a traditional Half-Life game. It‚Äôs set up as a linear series of areas, starting with a normal City 17 neighborhood and then moving underground, through industrial areas like a distillery, high-tech Combine facilities, slimy alien nests, and more. Each chapter of the 15-hour campaign feels substantially different from the last, including one that relies heavily on an unkillable antagonist you have to work your way around, and some that are all but pitch black except for your wrist-mounted flashlight.

Combat is a major part of the journey, but so is puzzle-solving. Some hacking puzzles pop up when you go to unlock various Combine technology. None of them are terribly complex ‚Äì for instance, there‚Äôs a memory-matching game where you connect points on a holographic sphere and a very cool-looking one where you trace the path of electricity through a wall and rotate connectors in a power-flow puzzle ‚Äì but all of them make heavy use of VR‚Äôs ability to work in three dimensions, and some of them actually get tricky when they scale up in the later levels. Disarming tripwire mines by tracing a path through rings as a burning fuse chases you ‚Äì while being careful not to accidentally trip the mine with your hand ‚Äì can get fairly intense.
And then there's the environmental puzzles. In true Half-Life fashion, getting from point A to point B is often more complicated than it sounds. I‚Äôd sometimes wander around an area wondering if I‚Äôd hit a bug and an event that would open a path forward hadn‚Äôt triggered; I always felt like a goof a few minutes later when I figured out that the solution was a trick that‚Äôd been explicitly taught to me earlier, or was pretty clearly marked by a wire or something. It's all there, once you learn what kinds of cues to look for. All of this serves as a welcome cooldown and counterbalance to combat.
This may be a prequel story, taking place five years before Half-Life 2, but you should absolutely be up to date on the events of the series through Half-Life 2: Episode 2 before you play Alyx. (You‚Äôve had 13 years ‚Äì it's time.) Alyx‚Äôs quest starts out as a simple mission to rescue her father, Dr. Eli Vance, and turns into a heist to capture a Combine superweapon stashed inside a massive floating vault above City 17 ‚Äì but of course, it‚Äôs not that simple. The ending is fantastic and a must-see for anyone who‚Äôs been invested in this story, and rest assured there are plenty of surprises you should avoid spoilers for.

All the while your remote, lovably oblivious and blunt sidekick Russell (distinctively voiced by Rhys Darby) chatters away in your ear with some laugh-out-loud gags about vodka and sandwiches, among a great many other things. It‚Äôs a very similar brand of humor to what Valve gave us with Wheatly in Portal 2, although he‚Äôs not evil. Probably. His rapport with Alyx gives her a chance to shine as a character as well, allowing her to reveal her optimism about the future and naivete about the world before the invasion. Appropriately, Russ‚Äô signal tends to be blocked out during the moodier, more horror-flavored moments, which lets Half-Life: Alyx create some fantastically spooky atmosphere.
Detail is one of the things Valve does best. Environments look amazing. You can see the hairs on the legs of the bloodthirsty, turducken-sized head crabs as they leap at your face trying to eat your brain ‚Äì although counting hairs is hardly the first of your concerns at a moment like that because animal instincts kick in and cause a jolt of panic. Healing stations squash a gross antlion grub in a vial and then inject its juices into your fingers through delicate robotic needles. Just about every poster or newspaper clipping you see up on a wall is fully written, either in English or Russian (I assume, anyway ‚Äì I can‚Äôt read Russian). Smashing open a supply crate yields a shower of packing peanuts as well as items.
It‚Äôs remarkable, and so is the actual way you interact with all of these objects. Outside of Boneworks, I‚Äôve never seen this level of physical interactivity in a VR world. Physics play a huge role because the vast majority of stuff that isn‚Äôt nailed down can be picked up and tossed around. Even better, your hands are real objects in the world that collide with everything realistically. Moves like sweeping your hand across a table to dramatically wipe everything off of it, pushing on a door ‚Äì not its handle, but anywhere on it ‚Äì to open it, and having to carefully move your hand between two bars in a fence instead of simply reaching through it like a ghost all make a huge, huge difference in establishing a feeling of presence in this world.
In the beginning of Half-Life 2, Alyx equips Gordon Freeman with the Gravity Gun ‚Äì but this is five years prior to those events. So here, Alyx straps on intricate Gravity Gloves that aren‚Äôt nearly as powerful as the gun, but are much more compact, always on-hand, and still extremely useful. Just point at any object you can see so it lights up, make a fist to grip it, and yank it toward you to send it satisfyingly flying your way so you can easily catch it out of the air. It‚Äôs the simplest of Jedi tricks but it works well after some practice. The secret here is that this is a clever way to cover up that moving around and bending down too much in VR is awkward and it‚Äôs much easier to bring objects to you than it is to move you to them. The gloves elegantly turn that weakness into an empowering strength.

That said, there isn‚Äôt as much physics-based mayhem as I expected coming off of Half-Life 2. Unlike the Gravity Gun, your Gravity Gloves have no launch ability, only a pull, so you can‚Äôt bisect enemies with saw blades and the like. Grenades have to be tossed with your normal human arms. It all works fine but as someone who loves the Gravity Gun I couldn‚Äôt help but want that full power in my hands. Room has to be left for a sequel, I suppose.
Instead, guns are your main instruments of defending yourself from lurching zombies, lunging headcrabs, dangling barnacle traps, armored Combine troopers, and worse. There are only three weapons (or five, counting grenades) in Half-Life: Alyx, but even the basic pistol you‚Äôre handed from the get-go has a powerful punch to it, and emptying a whole magazine into an interdimensional fascist feels awfully good. Keep in mind, though, that handling it, the shotgun, and the SMG are big adjustments if you‚Äôre not familiar with VR shooters and the more elaborate reloading procedures that are common when you‚Äôre holding a virtual gun in your hand.

Now, while I had fun for a bit with this game, it gets pretty depressing. For starters, half the maps in TTT don't work unless you have CS Source. That's not a big deal. Most of the servers are completely dead. No problem, just make your own - well, if you know how and get lucky that it'll be at the top of the server list. 

The biggest thing that my friends and I ran into were servers that we would hop onto, play on for a while, unlock items on said server (cosmetics, weapons, etc), and then the server would either shut down or stop being updated by the admins, effectively making it unplayable. 

I wouldn't recommend picking this game up at this point. If you are looking for a party game, there are MANY better options than this.

The ultimate sandbox that lets you create build and play whatever game mode someone has created or made. The communities in this game still exist, although the glory days are over, and there's always something to do. Only issue is overloading your PC with workshop mods. Some servers require you to download their mod packs because they require certain mods to function properly. If you do not have a beefy computer then be conservative with your mod load and clean out any mods you do not use or want to keep.

I am a 45 yo father, probably one of the oldest people playing this game. I am a single farther to my Son, who is 14 now. My son got this game for Christmas, so we installed it on his computer and he started playing. By the end of the week he had 24 hours on this game. This was horrible for me, as it was already hard for me to find ways to spend time with my son, as he is always out with his friends or just, watching YouTube. So i decided to make a Steam account and get this game to see if I could maybe play alongside him. loaded into the game, made my character and world and started playing but I was stuck on what you where supposed to do. I asked my Son for help and he hosted a game for me to join. loved it as it was the best time had spent with my Son since my wife had died. This game has ever since brought me and my son closer again and now we actually spend time together outside the house together as well. This game reminded me that there's fun to be had in everything, and it has brought both me and my Son many happy memories. this is satire. i reposted it because i was was bored, now shut the fuck up

This game saved my life.

I am 22.

My ex-wife and I have a daughter together, and adopted our son together. They are now both 4 years old.

When we were going through our separation, I found myself lost and miserable. I was self destructive. I got so mad one day from everything spiraling out of my control that I punched some concrete in a moment of overwhelming emotion. That caused me to break my 5th metacarpal in my right hand... my working hand... my games hand.. the hand that I held and carried my children to bed with.. The hand I desperately needed to make sure I could continue to provide.

After learning of the severity of my self-inflicted damage, I was borderline suicidal. Keep in mind that just a few months before this, I was the happiest man with no history of depression or anxiety. I have never had fits of rage, or been one to break down and cry, but I was in a low spot that just really buried me from being able to see the light on the other side.

Having nothing better to do, I searched for a game I could play, ONE HANDED while I recovered. I somehow stumbled upon this game and read some of the reviews. I decided that it had to be worth a shot... I must admit, I didn't beat the game, or play nearly as long as some of you. In fact, I may have only played this game a day or two.. With that being said, after doing so, I had a new found joy and hope for life. I was able to put behind me the pain and suffering that had been cast over me. I was able to experience other peoples joy and happiness. I was able to see the fruits of my "labor". I relaxed for 5 ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô• minutes to this music long enough to realize that I was going to be okay.

After coming to that realization, I turned the game off, and I went back to work. It hurt my hand like hell but I was motivated. I stopped feeling so damn sorry for myself, and I became the father I needed to be in that moment, not the weak boy I was behaving as.

Today, I am close friend with my kids mother. We don't fight, or argue, or say hurtful things to each other. We are parents, and friends.

I now have 3 kids. My third child is, wait for it, ALSO 4 YEARS OLD. The woman I am with was going through a very similar situation at the time of my own separation, and we just stumbled in to each others life unexpectedly. We have been in a relationship for a year now, and are very happy together.

Moral of the story, you never know what life holds in store for you, and if I would have given up when all the odds were stacked against me, I wouldn't be where I am today. This silly little game helped me realize that.

Usually I use a template for my steam Reviews, but here I go for this one.

Gary's Mod is Probably one of the best games ever. This game has the best Sandbox I've ever seen in a game.
You can literally do anything here, even installing shaders to have fun. Not only that, you can tweak the physics 
how you want, "Are you a coder? Do you like Gary's Mod but don't like it's Combat? Change it."
People have done amazing things with this game, and I have underplayed it. This deserves to be my most Played Game. This game will always go on. This game shall never die.
Seems like the end? Not yet.

Those 33 Hours I have on the game? 30 Of them have been with friends.
This game is even BETTER with friends. Goofing around until 12:00 AM is the best thing I have ever done in
my steam account. Heck there are PUBLIC SERVERS. And this game has no limits as I said before. With people making maps that are HUMONGOUS, or really Tiny. The possibilities are endless. "Do you not own a game? Find a mod for it in Gary's Mod. PLAY IT IN GMOD" 

This is my biggest review because I cannot explain how fun this game can get.
PLEASE. IF YOU ARE THINKING OF BUYING IT. YOU. WILL. NOT. REGRET. IT.

Best of all it has a loot box mechanic to enhance my experience even more by adding another exciting chance based layer to the game! Two week ago I spend all my money becoming a Raid Shadow Legend. Now I live in a dumpster outside a McDonald‚Äôs with free WiFi. At night I sneak into the McDonald‚Äôs like my new raccoon dad, Stripey, taught me to do so I can charge my phone. Through the cracked screen I am still perpetually amazed by the graphics of this game... they look so real! Thank you Obama, you truly changed my life!
